abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is assessed
            as satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The project
            was well designed, addressed key educational issues, with
            relevant, and clearly defined objectives, and had a direct
            link to the Government's medium-term plans in the
            sector. The lessons address: 1) Quality, which can be
            achieved by focusing on the acquisition of basic learning
            skills, and introducing an integrated approach at the school
            level, to promote student learning, teacher performance, and
            school development. Although the project did succeed in
            improving the delivery of quality of education, it did not
            however improve substantial learning, and achievement of
            students. Hence, the following operation is designed to
            adapt, and expand the school cluster model, to improve
            teaching, and learning, and will strengthen curriculum
            implementation. 2) Access, which can be improved through
            strategies targeting the neediest, to increase participation
            in education, and, interventions to increase girls, and
            out-of-school children enrollment. Further improvements
            would come through the appointment of female teachers,
            provision of textbooks, and scholarships, in addition to
            literacy programs, and strengthened support for teachers. 3)
            Institutional development, should be integrated into the
            education system, by reinforcing stability of staff,
            technical capacity building, and professional accountability.
